body_html:
@gchanan do you mean that instead of unwrapping the int value from the scalar, torch.Size should just be a tuple of ints and scalars? i.e.

>> x = torch.Size([1, scalar_two])
torch.Size([1, 2])
>>> x[1]
2 (scalar tensor)
>>> x[0]
1 (python long)
body_text:
@gchanan do you mean that instead of unwrapping the int value from the scalar, torch.Size should just be a tuple of ints and scalars? i.e.
>> x = torch.Size([1, scalar_two])
torch.Size([1, 2])
>>> x[1]
2 (scalar tensor)
>>> x[0]
1 (python long)
body:
@gchanan do you mean that instead of unwrapping the int value from the scalar, torch.Size should just be a tuple of ints and scalars? i.e. 
```
>> x = torch.Size([1, scalar_two])
torch.Size([1, 2])
>>> x[1]
2 (scalar tensor)
>>> x[0]
1 (python long)
```
